channel.title: Everyday Electronics!
channel.description:
I have some and you don't :P
They kinda look like this: http://www.mds975.co.uk/Images/mbrad4.jpeg http://farm1.static.flickr.com/22/33894396_77a83eaaf9.jpg
So yeah they have wonderful stuff in them. This is what boosted me into the electronics hobby., I'll post a photo of the ones I have :P
ITT: How did you get started? (I want details)

item.title: Everyday Electronics!
item.dc:creator: @newbiehacker newbiehacker
item.description:
@newbiehacker wrote:

[quote=“Server-Unknown.Net, post:10, topic:290020”][quote author=newbiehacker link=topic=383370.msg2903239#msg2903239 date=1249658266]
I’m a qualified electronic engineer, although obviously not highly qualified as I’m only 18 xD

But yeah, I got started in electronics from my pc really. Been using a computer since I Was about 8, started programming when I was about 13 and I’ve always enjoyed understanding how things work.
[/quote]

Aha, I used a computer for the first time when I was 6, my bro played this game called “Ray Jay” (if I can remember correctly), and it got my attention. I started coding around 13 all because I wanted to make my own custom website not like anyone elses on www.freewebs.com, but I didnt really get into it much like most people here have. I like drawing more than anything, beside girls ima beast when it comings to “showing” my feelings. I remember my first time I got a girlfriend drawing a heart with vines attached to my cartoon character. It was so tight, i still have it as of today. (I took my shit back after we broke up lol)

On topic:
I used to be into electronics but I ditched that hobby like 3 years ago lol. First thing I ever made was a box for lights when we had a hurricane, my mom or dad didnt know how to get lights around the house efficiently like I was able to, luckily I was there to save us during those “7” nights of no lights lol. We spent $100 worth of batteries and wire (like 20 I think), plus some switches. Took me a hour to do, I hooked it all around the main rooms in our house :D. We had sleep overs and everything lol, like 3 of our neighbors slept over that week. I didnt mind cuz I neva cant have anyone to sleep over at my house (cuz my bro got problems with people being in our house, he dont trust them cuz he think they might steal). We did good that whole week, although I wasnt able to get the microwave to work so we could warm our food up (lol I had like 10 huge batteries for 1 microwave and exploded it by mistake, I didnt look at the minimum watts on microwave rofl). The microwave was thrown away, we got another one now :D(LOL).

O yeah I really got into it when my teacher showed me and my classmates how to make a computer in the lab. I didnt take that knowledge far though, I abandoned it cuz I didnt feel interested about it.[/quote]

That was a very long rant, note: you’re an idiot. Blowing up a microwave and connecting a load of lights to batteries (why not just use 1 battery and connect the lights in parallel?) doesn’t really constitute as doing electronics.

Read full topic

item.title: Everyday Electronics!
item.dc:creator: @Server-Unknown.Net Server-Unknown.Net
item.description:
@Server-Unknown.Net wrote:

[quote=“newbiehacker, post:8, topic:290020”]I’m a qualified electronic engineer, although obviously not highly qualified as I’m only 18 xD

But yeah, I got started in electronics from my pc really. Been using a computer since I Was about 8, started programming when I was about 13 and I’ve always enjoyed understanding how things work.[/quote]

Aha, I used a computer for the first time when I was 6, my bro played this game called “Ray Jay” (if I can remember correctly), and it got my attention. I started coding around 13 all because I wanted to make my own custom website not like anyone elses on www.freewebs.com, but I didnt really get into it much like most people here have. I like drawing more than anything, beside girls ima beast when it comings to “showing” my feelings. I remember my first time I got a girlfriend drawing a heart with vines attached to my cartoon character. It was so tight, i still have it as of today. (I took my shit back after we broke up lol)

On topic:
I used to be into electronics but I ditched that hobby like 3 years ago lol. First thing I ever made was a box for lights when we had a hurricane, my mom or dad didnt know how to get lights around the house efficiently like I was able to, luckily I was there to save us during those “7” nights of no lights lol. We spent $100 worth of batteries and wire (like 20 I think), plus some switches. Took me a hour to do, I hooked it all around the main rooms in our house :D. We had sleep overs and everything lol, like 3 of our neighbors slept over that week. I didnt mind cuz I neva cant have anyone to sleep over at my house (cuz my bro got problems with people being in our house, he dont trust them cuz he think they might steal). We did good that whole week, although I wasnt able to get the microwave to work so we could warm our food up (lol I had like 10 huge batteries for 1 microwave and exploded it by mistake, I didnt look at the minimum watts on microwave rofl). The microwave was thrown away, we got another one now :D(LOL).

O yeah I really got into it when my teacher showed me and my classmates how to make a computer in the lab. I didnt take that knowledge far though, I abandoned it cuz I didnt feel interested about it.

Read full topic

item.title: Everyday Electronics!
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“BloodRayne, post:7, topic:290020”]Started getting interested by reading Kipkay’s(google it) guides, then watching his videos. I had always been interested in electronics, tinkering with things, taking them apart, etc. I’m in my third year of engineering now, learning more about design(using c4d, autodesk, etc). Last two years were all electronics though, and I loved it ^^

Writing at 2:21am cbf to make it sound good x][/quote]

Kipkay is pretty awesome but tends to get boring sometimes. One thing I do like is the weekend projects that makezine do, I want bre pettis back though

Read full topic

item.description:

I’m a qualified electronic engineer, although obviously not highly qualified as I’m only 18 xD

But yeah, I got started in electronics from my pc really. Been using a computer since I Was about 8, started programming when I was about 13 and I’ve always enjoyed understanding how things work.

item.title: Everyday Electronics!
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Started getting interested by reading Kipkay’s(google it) guides, then watching his videos. I had always been interested in electronics, tinkering with things, taking them apart, etc. I’m in my third year of engineering now, learning more about design(using c4d, autodesk, etc). Last two years were all electronics though, and I loved it ^^

Writing at 2:21am cbf to make it sound good x]

Read full topic
